text: Michael Carley (1940 – 17 March 2019) was an Irish Gaelic footballer who played at club level with St Mary's Rochfortbridge, St Loman's, The Downs and Tyrrellspass and at inter-county level with the Westmeath senior football team. He usually lined out as a full-back. Carley is regarded as one of Westmeath's all-time greatest players. ==Honours== ;St Mary's CBS *Leinster Colleges Senior B Football Championship (1): 1955 ;St Mary's Rochfortbridge *Westmeath Intermediate Football Championship (1): 1958 ;St Loman's *Westmeath Senior Football Championship (2): 1961, 1963 ;The Downs *Westmeath Senior Football Championship (5): 1968, 1969, 1970, 1972, 1974 ;Westmeath *O'Byrne Cup (2): 1959, 1964 ;Leinster *Railway Cup (2): 1961, 1962 ==References== Category:1940 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Westmeath inter-county Gaelic footballers Category:Leinster Gaelic footballers Category:People from County Westmeath
title: Mick Carley
